captions.text: So the stunt we are trying to do is two Volvo trucks speeding down the highway towards a tunnel
and I have to walk across the line before they come to the tunnel.
Because basically if I don't finish walking across the line
the midpart between the tunnels will hit the line, it will snap, and I will fall.
In the event that we do have an accident
it will be myself or Robin that will obviously call for assistance.
So what do you think of this stunt?
It is crazy, it is crazy.
I have highlined much higher than this before.
I have highlined on longer lines and I have highlined in harsher winds.
But I have never slacklined moving forward before.
Too far apart and the line breaks, to close together and she falls off.
I try not to let very much go through my mind.
It’s better to just focus on walking and getting to the anchor.
This stunt was set up to demonstrate the precision and control of the new Volvo FH series
It was carried out by professionals on a closed highway

title: Volvo Trucks - The Ballerina Stunt (Live Test 1)

comments.text:
Love the music - very action based but with suspense - especially the 
violins.  Also love the helicopter camera work.  What amazing balance - 
speed plus momentum plus wind / air pressure all doing their best to work 
against you.  This is skill like no other.  After she reaches the other 
truck and is crouching on the roof, she looks like a silhouette of Splinter 
Cell / Sam Fisher :)﻿

comments.author: mieguistumas

comments.text:
+Ken Hanson Two takes. During crossing, look how little sag there was, 
tension must have been 1000 to 10000 lbs. During "cable snap" tension was 
much lower and cable was allowed to pull out of the frames on the two 
trucks. Think what would have happened if it weren't released from the 
trucks and the cable can support 10000 lbs. Major damage to the trailers.
comments.author: Ken Hanson

comments.text:
Probably real crossing with tunnel looking closer than it was, and faking 
the timing between her jump and the cable breaking. In reality that cable 
would have whipped and probably hurt her, if she had been there when it was 
severed.

comments.text:
I disagree. The Van Damme splits have the trucks driving backwards. Had Van 
Damme split across the trailers, or if the trucks moved forward, I wouldn't 
have been all that impressed by the drivers. But somehow they manage to 
keep the trucks following their set trajectory to the inch, while matching 
each others speed. I'm still not convinced they didn't reverse that video. 
If it's real, it's one of the most impressive driving feats ever. The 
slackline one is entertaining, but hard to believe. How was the line 
released?

comments.author: Togar George

comments.text:
Do you really think that the truck drivers would have kept going to the 
tunnels if they weren't absolutely certain that she had completed the 
crossing?? There are truth and lies in this video. She did walked that rope 
between the trucks while they were moving, but the speed of the moving 
trucks is exaggerated, and she didn't "make it just in time". The Van Damme 
stunt is much better because it was just one take, without special effects 
or editing. He was however discretely tethered to prevent serious injury if 
he fell.﻿
